definition: to accept a gift/to receive presents
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: Either the recipient hates them or they're the wrong size.
sentences.chinese: 要麼是收禮人根本不喜歡，要麼是東西送錯了尺寸。

sentences.english: So maybe the art of receiving is even more difficult than the art of giving.
sentences.chinese: 因此也許收禮的藝術甚至要比給予的藝術更難。

sentences.english: Gifts are not opened when received.
sentences.chinese: 收禮時不能當面打開禮物。

sentences.english: Comp: He not only refused the gift, he also severely criticized the young sender.
sentences.chinese: 他不僅拒絕收禮，而且嚴厲地批評了年輕的送禮者。

definition: supplementary cash reserve/private fund/private hoard/slush fund
to listen with respectful attention/(a polite request to sb to speak)/we are all ears
to try to answer a question (in a quiz, guessing game, riddle etc)/quiz game
to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
to sign for the acceptance of sth (e.g. a delivery etc)
